questions.text: What TV show did Annabeth tell the candidates the network would switch to if the convention went over two hours?
questions.explanation:
Seinfeld.

	Leo wanted Annabeth to look over the speeches and make sure they were ten minutes long so they could keep the network happy.

questions.text: How did Leo choose who would be speaking first at the convention?
questions.explanation:
Rock, scissors, paper.

	Josh told Santos that Hoynes was going to speak first because his representative chose paper and paper covers rock. Will and Josh were both rocks.

questions.text: What day was the President flying out to announce the Democratic candidate for President?
questions.explanation:
Wednesday.

	Leo told Josh and Will that he wanted a candidate chosen before the President flew to California on Wednesday so he didn't have to choose a side.

questions.text: Who did the President say was also in the running for President?
questions.explanation:
Aaron Burr.

	While watching the Democratic Convention of television, President Bartlet said, "It's a free-for-all. I think Aaron Burr's got twenty votes."

questions.text: The rumor of Baker's wife having a history of depression was given to the press by whom?
questions.explanation:
Will.

	Donna begged Will not to do it because it would look bad on them, but Will did it anyway and it backfired on him.

questions.text: When Josh told Ronna that he was leaving the convention center to go "beg an old friend". Who did he go see?
questions.explanation:
Hoynes.

	Josh went to Hoynes to talk him into dropping out of the race and supporting Santos. Hoynes did drop out of the race.

questions.text: During the convention, people put up "Draft Baker" signs.
questions.explanation:
True.

	NBC executives wanted to cut the convention and go to something else, but Annabeth told him that people were on the floor with signs positioning Baker for President. Leo told Susan, the NBC executive, that if she wanted to switch to an episode of "Law & Order" she could.

questions.text: Who got the 2162 votes which made him the Democratic candidate for President?
questions.explanation:
Santos.

	The announcement was made over the television that Leo was listening to at the convention center.

questions.text: Who said, "We are all broken, every single one of us"?
questions.explanation:
Santos.

	Santos: "We're all broken - every single one of us - and yet we pretend that we're not. We all live lives of imperfection and yet we cling to the fantasy that there's a perfect life and that our leaders should embody it, but if we expect our leaders to live on some higher moral plane than the rest of us, well, we're just asking to be deceived.Don't vote for us because you think we're perfect. Don't vote for us because of what we might be able to do for you only. Vote for the person who shares your ideals, your hopes, your dreams. Vote for the person who most embodies what you believe we need to keep our nation strong and free."

questions.text: Josh asked Leo to be Santos' Vice President.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Josh came to Leo and told him they found a Vice President and when Leo asked who it was, Josh told Leo it was him. The last scene of the episode was Bartlet introducing Matthew Vincente Santos and Leo Thomas McGarry as the Democratic choice for President and Vice President.
